results.name: Number of bisections of the n-th binary palindrome bit pattern until the result is not palindromic
comment: Let k=1, p(1)=A006995(n) and m(1)=number of bits in p(1); if p(k) is a binary palindrome > 1 then iterate k=k+1, m(k)=floor((m(k-1)+1)/2), p(k)=leftmost m(k) bits of p(k-1); else set a(n)=k endif.
formula: Case 1: a(n)=1+a(A206915(f(n))), if f(n) is a binary palindrome;
example: a(5)=3, since A006995(5)=7=111_2 and so the iteration is 11==>11==>1;
a(9)=2, since A006995(9)=21=10101_2 and so the iteration is 10101==>101;
